lines.text:
[posing as an outlaw and intervening as Sandy, who is playing his part as a janitor, is being mistreated]
What are you getting so riled up about? It was just an accident.
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text: Accident - nuthin'! He ought to know how to handle a mop by now.
Well, some people are born to handle mops; some are not, as you seem to know so much about.
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text:
[authoritatively]
Just pick up that mop and show him how.
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text:
[referring to Buck after finding out he's an undercover marshal]
I'm gonna take him outta this deal, and I'm gonna do it my way - tonight!

[role-playing janitor when he knows Scully can hear]
Well, glad there ain't no hard feelin's fella.

[staying in character as an outlaw]
Aw, forget it!
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text: Take this and buy yourself a clean shirt.
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text:
[inquiring about the sheriff's interest in him]
What's this all about?
Well, nuthin'. The sheriff here's got my number, but he's on the wrong street.
lines.character: Marshal Buck Roberts posing as John Robbins

lines.text:
[last words]
Watch for THE ROUGH RIDERS when they ride again.
